level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: The term "appropriate authority" as used in this compact means, with reference to the District of Columbia, the Director of the Child and Family Services Agency for children who have been abused or neglected and the Director of the Department of Human Services for all other children.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 2-1515.08, § 4-1303.02a, and § 4-1303.03.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-277 rewrote the section which prior thereto read:
"The term 'appropriate authority' as used in this compact means, with reference to the District, the Director of the Department of Human Services."

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-30
level.text: Law 8-30, "Interstate Compact on the Placement of Children Authorization Act of 1989," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-107, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 30, 1989 and June 13, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 27, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-53 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-277
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-277, see notes following § 4-1301.02.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: For applicability of D.C. Law 13-277, see note following § 4-1303.01a.
